Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.utils

Class ClientConnectionStatusHandler

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
it.polimi.ingsw.network.utils.ConnectionStatusHandler
it.polimi.ingsw.network.utils.ClientConnectionStatusHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<CommunicationMessage>, Runnable
public class ClientConnectionStatusHandler extends ConnectionStatusHandler implements Observer<CommunicationMessage>
A connection status handler used client-side.

It gets notified when a new PING message is received by the client and responds immediately with a PONG.

If the client does not receive a ping for more than 2*PING_TIMEOUT_DELAY milliseconds, than a PingTimeoutExceededTask is run (the connection will be aborted).

See Also:
  • Client
  • PingTimeoutExceededTask
  • ConnectionStatusHandler

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the ClientConnectionStatusHandler. It will periodically schedule a PingTimeoutExceededTask which will be removed when the client receives a ping from the server.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class ConnectionStatusHandler
      See Also:

    • kill

      public void kill()
      Description copied from class: ConnectionStatusHandler
      Kills the connection by setting false the attribute connectionActive

      If connectionActive is false, then a call to isConnectionActive (always called by the client and server before reading or sending a new message) will return false, so the client/server will be closed.

      Specified by:
      kill in class ConnectionStatusHandler

    • isConnectionActive

      public boolean isConnectionActive()
      Description copied from class: ConnectionStatusHandler
      Returns whether the connection is still alive or not.
      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true if the connection is alive, false otherwise.

    • update

      public void update(CommunicationMessage message)
      The object gets notified of ping messages. When a PING message is received the Client answers back immediately with a PONG message and resets the timer, by cancelling the previous scheduled task.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<CommunicationMessage>
      Parameters:
      message - the message notified by the client.
